title: Dancer sues Disney for £80,000 after being injured in Lion King West End show
text:
Jodie Standish, 28, claims the injury ruined her stage career (Picture: Champion News/Rex)

A dancer claims her career on the stage was ruined when she suffered an injury while working on a West End production of The Lion King.

Former backstage technician Jodie Standish, 28, damaged her shoulder while moving a section of scenery in 2015.

The former Great Britain gymnast, who trained as a dancer for musical theatre, said the injury deprived her of a ‘lucrative’ opportunity to appear in a stage show in Dubai.

Miss Standish, from Bexley, south-east London, wants Disney to pay her £80,000 in damages.

In a writ lodged with Central London County Court, her barrister Richard Moat said the accident happened on August 27, 2015, during an evening performance of the show.

Jodie Standish has taken Disney to court Picture: Champion News)

Mr Moat states: ‘During the course of the show, she was given the all-clear by another crew member to push scenery out on stage.

‘As she was pushing a rolling platform out onto the stage, it collided with a lighting tower which should have been moved out of a position where she could make contact with the tower, causing the rolling platform to ricochet backwards, hitting her right shoulder and causing her to sustain injury loss and damage.

‘Prior to this incident, there had been issues where the rolling platform had come into contact with the lighting tower at the same course of the performance.’

Actors perform during the dress rehearsal of the musical ‘The Lion King’ (Picture: Rex)

Disney is fighting the case despite being ‘primarily liable’ for the accident.

The media firm’s barrister Matthew Brunning claimed Miss Standish had pre-existing problems and would probably not have been able to fulfil the Dubai contract, even if there had been no accident.

A trial of the case is set to go ahead next summer over three days.

Ms Standish now works as a personal trainer.

description: A dancer claims her career on the stage was ruined when she suffered an accident while working on a West End production of The Lion King.
